topic.title: p2p/decentralized backend and database for json data
topic.body:
surprised there isn't anyone working on p2p backends or p2p databases that runs similar to ipfs where you run a node/peer.

with ipfs you have a peer that saves static files. i wonder how difficult if someone did the same thing for regular databases. i know databses can be distributed but obviously its not like running a ipfs peer. same thing with backends. lets say you run a decentralized daemon, and then you register a bucket and throw your backend files. and then if someone likes your stuff they can host it too. everyone is familiar with client-server model. if the main parts of a website(frontend app, backend server, database, static files, streaming media) can have decentralized equivalent systems then it can make adoption a lot easier and it will grow the user base.

topic.body:
i had some blogs that people were seeding but it was using the zeroblog theme which doesn't have some features that i am used to. i found a better theme, cloned it and moved all my posts to it. so i got new zite address and have to start over as far as seeders. instead of making a thread every time i make a new blog or make a new post, i will just keep updating this thread. that way i don't make too many threads.

topic.title: an app to share back-end packages with other users and run those apps at the same time
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/15Pm3vX7uUqtBdXKMkquQceJ7nyQ58dSJ4

that is the repo on gitcenter on zeronet, its a nodejs app

i had this idea where multiple people can run the same bkac-end server app at the same time with a hash, like this

someHASH8274376/some/route/endpoint

when someone hits that endpoint, then the someHASH8274376 turns into a url/ip like -> 182.456.234.345:3000/some/route/endpoint or someurl.com/some/route/endpoint the hash basically routes to a random url/ip that is sharing that backend app. so multiple people can run a specific app. unfortunately, it did not work out. i couldn't make something that automatically routes to a random address. i got close though. i will make a tutorial for this app. i will keep on working at it and see if i can finish it out exactly how i wanted it. as of right now this is how it works.

it uses webtorrent and hyperswarm-dht to keep up with peers. webtorrent is used to share the apps/packages with other peers. and then when you run those apps, the dht share that address, with the command inputs you can do look ups and see who else is running that same app. once i post a tutorial, i will paste it here.

1591510796_146FHU77ti4zcQNWbtin8fWNRCLd8.body: they have orbitdb which saves the json data in a static file on ipfs, don't know how the performance would be for large sites
there is also  the fediverse but it can still fall into the same issues

> [ls9125s](#comment_19_1MoiNscMBZopwz1HdWDky1kXHAb4GrTruH): SQLitehttps://www.sqlite.org/saves all of the data into a database instance specific file that is determined at the initialization of a database connection. SQLite is implemented as a C library. The PHP stdlib includes that C library, meaning, SQLite is supported by PHP by default without any database drivers. SQLite is supported by many, if not all, programming languages and an SQLite database size can be multiple GiB, although the SQLite file based approach is totally unsuitable for a situation, when a lot of threads tries to access the database at once, as is the case with web sites with lots of simultaneous visitors. The SQLite supports almost all of the standard SQL. That being said, a "back end" is still an oxymoron in the ZeroNet world. What might be done is that the browser side JavaScript might usehttps://github.com/emscripten-core/emscripten/wikito run a console application that is written in C and that console application might run the SQLite, which might read in the SQLite database, but that unnecessarily complicates things, because then the option might already be the use of thehttps://javascript.info/indexeddbcombined with thehttps://jsstore.net/ [...]

be a better model later by improving as you go along. adoption and user traffic is what matters and what decides what gets used. a similar but different model will makes sure that any regular user can smoothly move over and use. a model that is too different will be lowered to an alternative with low amount of users worse it might be known as a place for "dark underground people"...... EXACTLY what people say about zeronet. i see zeronet and the idea zeronet brings as a piece of a bigger whole

You just go there and start saying things a little more fun than the Catholic Church. Like you're a prophet and instead of using vaccines you're working a miracle. Religion or region, I've always liked doing things like that, but you must have a lot of friends to do it with. The truth is that very few people want adventure. At least 10 that I told, only one of them said, "that's cool." And you know, to do things like that, you need people you trust around you.

sub-saharan africa is the region this post was about, looks like you got it somehow. there are multiple ways movement of people can happen. you are right, most people do not like adventures. for example now in the modern day, economic/easy life is clearly one of the biggest reason, if not the biggest reason. like the mass movement of people into europe. then you also have it where countries sends their own small group of people somewhere else, because population density reasons or security reasons. like uk sending their prisoners to australia. it is not for the adventure, fewer people will go because of a journey. the more things move forward, sub-saharan africa looks like it hits multiple points for people.

first economic, you have china, russia, india, and few other countries trying to do a lot of things there. especially china, they are doing a lot of things there. they are at the bottom compared to the world, they can not develop the resources they have since they have no industry. second women/family, countries across north africa to east asia have more males than females. i can see them having incentives to go there to find females to have sex and have a family later. you have a region where you can send some of your frustrated male population. third low cost, once these workers and foreigners find out they can live cheaply, there might be an entire supply of people(mostly males at first) that would be interested to go there. fourth conquer, there are always few guys who wants to take over places. pretty self-explanatory, this place should be the easiest to take over.

i am seeing a lot of connections. i might be off, i just wouldn't be surprised by seeing something like this happening in the future. it has all the ingredients.

i didn't think about the religion part though, huh i can see that. people might want to go and spread themselves by using religion. asian christians might wanna go there, i have met some. you got arabs too. you have talked to others about stuff like this, nice. i wish i knew more people who can talk about things like these. its very interesting. i find it fascinating. i think the more the years go by, the more people(mostly guys) will be doing unconventional things like this. especially as the world changes, this year alone has been pretty crazy.
yeah dumber people might be more superstitious. superstition might be a good way to get in.

yeah, you want people you trust at first. other than if it is business, or something backed by an organization. you have any prediction for the next 20 to 30 years? how the world will go, anything you are certain and sure about? by the way also, how often do you get on zeronet and how long you been using it? i don't talk to a lot of people like you, most folks wouldn't receive this post in a positive way or wouldn't care.

> [frankwalter](#comment_30_18LjTpx4UtPSFfAZi8kfoyWasJq9gZCCkV): The estimate I made before, 1/10, is a lot, keep in mind that my friends are among the new generations, all in their twenties. I have the impression that many are returning these feelings especially in the new generations. Also consider that it is also right that not everyone has them. Even in the past there were craftsmen who all they wanted to do was crafts. It is normal for only a minority (like 1/10) to consider such things as fun. However, the problem is another, today's society makes people feel very small, able to do nothing if alone, I don't know if you have heard around that on average people underestimate what they can do in 10 years. These feelings remain only dreams therefore. But what do you care? It is not necessary for others to have these feelings. As long as you have them. However if you are interested in a prediction here's what I think: [...]

there are multiple reasons why i care about things like these. but i can sum it up with accountability for communities of human beings that live around each other. you will have multiple regions that will be hosting multiple groups of people. its efficient and cool if they fit into a certain standard, but few groups out there on the average will be an anchor weighing the rest down. few of these groups will not be able to meet certain societal standards. case in point, sub-saharan africans. sub-saharan africa is also one region that is growing in population, and it is growing beyond what the local environment would naturally handle because of importing things from the west and the rest of the world. now add in globalism and movements of people initiated by the established powers (the west, usa, israel, saudi arabia, power projecting from usa). with all this you have them moving up to europe. with eu approving all this, the western european countries take the hit. this is one example. maybe as things move forward, they will move to asia or australia, or latin america. i can not help but see a big contrast between some immigrants. so i thought what is the best way to take care of the immigration issue? have probably the last great adventure on earth, and change the place where the sub-standard immigrants are coming from. it starts with the mind, mentality, will, desire, uncomfortable existence that makes one change themselves and their thinking. it will be good if you are correct about the new generation. a new paradigm of thinking would be nice to see from people. these things are interesting to me, so it is a thought exercise. it was one scenario that seemed very interesting. though i am aware the future/fate/life/god/universe/take your pick lol, will bring what it wants to bring. this was more of the on the ground, political/human events stuff. now on to the more interesting stuff.

glad you brought up colonization of extraterrestrial places. yes, mars, utilizing the moon, orbital habitats for building vehicles and ships. also airships in venus which would have the perfect atmospheric pressure for people up high in the venus sky. i am sure one day the outer solar system will be utilized as well. opening space will obviously not happen quickly. but people will be surprised how much space will change 15 to 30 years. then you have the maybe the start of longevity with longer lifetimes. i have been seeing more stuff on anti-aging field and they seem like they are doing a lot of work. also prosthetics. awesome to see, would be nice to get some years back lol. interesting times we live in.

1594775906_1ufDwJisEDriKQxYJSz2HuUhgqAG1.body: if it is possible, and from what i read it seems doable, then yeah its a great idea. so you download a single app, in this case zerome. that app comes with its own instance package of zeronet which runs. but it only focus and runs zerome as the only site/app. so you just have to make the ui/look/feel of zerome better. while i know javascript/nodejs and a little python. i never did a big project like this. i have only made basic front-ends and basic backends. vuejs, and nodejs/express. made my own version of a very small and light "chan" sites, so basic stuff, kind of boilerplate code. i haven't coded in awhile though. but coding concepts are the same so i am sure i didn't forget everything. i would be better for the internet marketing phase. its what i have been doing for a long time.

1595165517_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: when i first came to zeronet i loved it, i still do. but as you said, zerotalk and zerome and other zero places are not as active anymore. i loved the content and conversations that happened here. sure, i saw crazy, zannie and trolly things sometimes, but most of the stuff was thought provoking and actually interesting. if people on zeronet are moving over to seeding movies and just watching movies then that would suck because that means less content creating. you have clearnet for movies. if people are just creating their own videos instead of writing then i can understand that, making videos of your thoughts and opinions is easier than writing. i just hope people are not sitting for hours watching mainstream movies when they can do that on clearnet. things like zeronet is needed, i made a lot of blogs which i plan on updating when ever i want to write about something. i'm thinking of making videos where i can elaborate on the things i write about. if i share my ideas about humanity, the world, the future, religion, culture and other things my posts would be buried if not removed even though i never use hateful or harsh words. in here people actually consider ideas and talk.
